title: Blockchain Download slow
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.3.5`
OS & Version: Windows
Commit hash : (if `develop`)
#### Expected behaviour

Blockchain Download with --fast  should be done in 3 Hours.
#### Actual behaviour

Blockchain Download --fast works to Block 1,2 Mio but now there will only be downloaded 1:1 Block.
I am Downloading the Blockchain for more then 4 Hours and only the half is downloaded (1,2 Mio Block)

So i get only 3 Blocks a Minute :(
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
#### Backtrace

```
[backtrace]
```

`fast` only works on an empty blockchain for security reasons. We are, however, looking in to the possibilities of changing that to work on _any_ chain. Fast sync should complete under 20 minutes on a modern cpu + SSD.

Hi @obscuren !
I started with an Empty Blockchain Folder und a clean Windows Install.
I have a i3 and a new Samsung 850 SSD.

a few days befor i tested it on Ubuntu on the same pc and geth --rpc --fast was finished after an hour.


If i cancle the sync and wait for 24 hours he starts to download 256 blocks a few times.
Then he only downloads 1 by one, also after a restart of the pc.
So there muss be an dependency on time and blocks downloaded.
That's because you're done catching and now it stays in sync, receiving a block every ~17 seconds.
